title: Drawing, Decoration with portrait of Pope Pius VI and for a royal couple
title_raw: Decoration with portrait of Pope Pius VI and for a royal couple
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Three ovoidal portraits are intended to hang in front of a curtain. Pope Pius is shown, above. Below is a festoon of a cord with two frames hanging on its ends. Colored background. An account is written, at left.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Decoration with portrait of Pope Pius VI and for a royal couple. Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash. 
Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1845
